CatDescriptText: George E. Lang, student, Dormont, and Melvin Strong, Manchester, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, November 25, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think Negroes should hold high political offices, particularly those which have payrolls attached?" George E. Lang's answer reads: "In my opinion, Negroes are no different from whites... A capable Negro is just as capable as a capable white."  Melvin Strong's answer reads: "Yes, sir.  I do believe they should."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of George E. Lang wearing eyeglasses, light colored coat buttoned to neck and with upturned collar, and slicked back hairstyle, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, Downtown; Portrait of Melvin Strong wearing patterned shirt with opened collar, and light colored coat, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
